title: Add real-time extraction pipeline tracking and visualization
description:
Enable real-time visibility into extraction process so users can see what is happening during corpus item extraction, including:

- Which items are currently being extracted
- What stage/pipeline step each item is at
- What intermediate artifacts (extracted text, metadata) are being produced
- Real-time progress, statistics, and estimated time remaining
- Final stage results and confidence scores

Currently extraction progress is only logged to stderr; this feature will:
1. Stream extraction events from the pipeline (item started, stage completed, item finished, errors)
2. Expose real-time extraction status via API endpoints
3. Update the dashboard to show live extraction progress and per-stage artifact inspection
4. Allow users to monitor extraction of large corpora without polling manifests
design:
ARCHITECTURAL APPROACH:

## Event Streaming System
- Add extraction event publisher to build_extraction_snapshot()
- Emit events for: item_started, stage_entered, stage_completed, item_finished, error_occurred
- Events include: timestamp, item_id, stage_index, stage_name, artifact paths, status

## Real-time API Surface
- POST /api/corpora/{name}/extractions/{snapshot_id}/subscribe (SSE or WebSocket)
- GET /api/corpora/{name}/extractions/{snapshot_id}/status (current live status)
- GET /api/corpora/{name}/extractions/{snapshot_id}/events/{item_id} (event history for item)

## Dashboard Changes
- Live extraction progress page showing:
  - Total items / items processed / ETA
  - Active items with current stage
  - Per-stage aggregate stats
  - Failed items with error details
  - Clickable items to inspect intermediate artifacts

## Data Model Extensions
- ExtractionEvent (item_id, stage_index, event_type, timestamp, artifact_info)
- ExtractionLiveStatus (snapshot_id, processed_count, active_items[], aggregate_stats)
- Persist events to manifest for reproducibility

## Implementation Order
1. Define event models and emission points in extraction.py
2. Add in-memory event queue with subscriber pattern
3. Add API endpoints for status/events
4. Add dashboard live progress component
5. Add test scenarios for multi-stage pipelines

title: Add real-time analysis pipeline tracking and visualization
description:
Enable real-time visibility into analysis pipeline execution so users can monitor analysis backends (profiling, topic-modeling, markov) as they run, including:

- Current analysis stage (e.g., "Text Collection", "LLM Extraction", "BERTopic Training", "State Naming")
- Stage progress: input/output document counts, processing rate
- Overall progress: total items processed, ETA, stage dependencies
- Intermediate results: segment counts, observation counts, model convergence metrics
- Cache hits/misses and their impact on performance
- Warnings and errors per stage with context
- Cancellation capability for long-running analyses

Currently analysis progress is only logged to stderr and runs synchronously to completion with no real-time updates. This feature will:
1. Emit analysis events from backend pipelines (stage_started, stage_progress, stage_completed, error_occurred)
2. Expose real-time analysis status via API endpoints (similar to extraction)
3. Update dashboard to show live analysis progress with per-stage metrics
4. Support backend-specific stage visualizations (e.g., topic model convergence for topic-modeling)
design:
ARCHITECTURAL APPROACH:

## Analysis Event Streaming System
- Add callback/event publisher interface to CorpusAnalysisBackend base class
- Each backend (Profiling, TopicModeling, Markov) emits events:
  - stage_started(stage_name, stage_index)
  - stage_progress(stage_name, metrics={"input_count", "output_count", "rate"})
  - stage_completed(stage_name, stage_report)
  - error_occurred(stage_name, error_type, message)
  - cache_event(cache_key, hit_or_miss, impact)

- Events include: timestamp, analysis_type, snapshot_id, stage_name, stage_index, metrics, status

## Backend-Specific Metrics
- **Profiling**: Document count, percentile calculations, tag filter impacts
- **Topic-Modeling**: Documents per stage, entities removed, topics discovered, LLM fine-tuning convergence
- **Markov**: Segments created, observations encoded, transition matrix density, state naming progress, topic assignments

## Real-time API Surface
- POST /api/corpora/{name}/analysis/{analysis_type}/{snapshot_id}/subscribe (SSE or WebSocket)
- GET /api/corpora/{name}/analysis/{analysis_type}/{snapshot_id}/status (current live status)
- GET /api/corpora/{name}/analysis/{analysis_type}/{snapshot_id}/stages (stage history with metrics)
- POST /api/corpora/{name}/analysis/{analysis_type}/{snapshot_id}/cancel (stop long-running analysis)

## Dashboard Changes
- Live analysis progress page showing:
  - Current stage with stage-specific metrics
  - Stage progression timeline
  - Per-stage input/output document counts
  - Cache hit rate for cached operations
  - Error and warning log for current run
  - Estimated time to completion (if applicable)

## Data Model Extensions
- AnalysisEvent (analysis_type, stage_name, stage_index, event_type, timestamp, metrics)
- AnalysisLiveStatus (snapshot_id, current_stage, processed_count, total_count, stage_metrics[])
- AnalysisStageMetrics (varies by backend)
- Persist events to manifest for reproducibility

## Implementation Order
1. Add event callback interface to CorpusAnalysisBackend
2. Emit events from each backend (Profiling, TopicModeling, Markov)
3. Create in-memory event queue with subscriber pattern (shared with extraction)
4. Add API endpoints for status/events/stages
5. Add dashboard live analysis progress component
6. Add backend-specific metric visualizations
7. Add cancellation support (if needed)
notes:
RELATED WORK:
This feature is complementary to Biblicus-5fp (extraction tracking).

Both features share:
- Common real-time event streaming architecture
- Shared API endpoint patterns
- Shared dashboard component patterns
- In-memory event queue with subscriber callbacks

Key difference:
- Extraction tracks per-item progress across stages
- Analysis tracks aggregate progress through backend-specific stages

Recommendation: Implement extraction tracking first (Biblicus-5fp), then leverage that architecture for analysis tracking.
